title: Before 1 January 2018, will a Chinese government entity or state owned enterprise take a stake in Youku Tudou, Tencent, or Weibo?
preds: I don't think this will actually happen. The Chinese tech giants will go farther to advance Chinese government goals to avoid this, simply to avoid the global repercussions on the company.

Absolutely. Look at the Beijing Court decision to use WeChat to file lawsuits electronically, as well as replace government issued IDs w WeChat. If they have not already, they certainly will by the end of the year.
Probability is likely high, but not before the new year. It takes time to structure these proposals.
Chinese goverment takes a very active role in funding takeovers.
China is likely to wait for the new year

-seems a long way from proposal to actual stake with q deadline in a month
- does seem like something this regime would like to do (+20)
- easier to say they aren't picking all the other companies they could be involved in than to say they would specifically pick these three

On the gold price/ 27th Dec question:
Isn't it convenient that during a minute the LBMA sets PM price at 15:00 (GMT) we dropped to $1,279.40 and then back up again? Hmm
On the daily price chart it is very easy to see the 15:00 dip
If the Chinese government follows through, it will likely be after the Chinese New Year, Feb 16, 2018.
- CN's government will increase control of censor ship, not the corporations, Chinese ownership is key, limited foreign ownership and products.
I think they will, it's really the timing that is the question.
I think the Chinese government won't make a move right now while these companies are performing so well on their own, and there are only six days left before this deadline anyway, so, unlikely.
Few major transactions are conducted in the last few days of the year.
Chinese government keeps assuming power and authority over the region largely unopposed.
Far to late in the year to announce such events. Low probability event. 1-3% est. skewed to 1.
I would expect this as more likely in a government BTFD scenario, but nothing like that is ongoing in equity markets.
Chinese gov't has long held stock in Chinese finance, fuel, transportation, communication. At some point it will buy into e-commerce. But not by the end of the year.
They are trying to regulate crypto currency more, and bitcoin miners, but a move by the government to interfere with an e' company would be a negative market move before the end of the year.

1.) This event may occur, but the CCP isn't under any pressure to announce it. 2.) The Party can control these companies perfectly well via its onsite cadres. 3.) “Foreknowledge cannot be gotten from ghosts and spirits, cannot be had by analogy, cannot be found out by calculation. It must be obtained from people, people who know the conditions of the enemy.” ― Sun Tzu, The Art of War
This may happen before the 1 of Jan but will not be reported until weeks afterwards.

- short of time
- markets heated up. So who buys a significant(!) share now?
Due to the short time frame
